title: How to schedule my goals and stay committed - Quora

response.answer_text: With a notebook and a pen. This is a foolproof system. All it takes is self-discipline (which is easier said than done), but if you follow through on it, it works. Take yearly goals and break them into monthly goals. After that, take your goals for the month and work backwards to see what you need to do every week. After that, schedule your week day-to-day. Write out what you need to do every day if you are going to complete your tasks by the end of Saturday, and then stick to it. Then comes the fun part. For every “weekly goal” that you don’t complete on time, put ten dollars in a jar for an organization whose cause you hate. This establishes the necessary “pain of inaction.” I can guarantee you by the end of the first month you’ll be a goal-crushing machine. Dreams only become reality by maintaining a strictly disciplined commitment to self promises. Write out what you need to do, and then do it. Simple as that.

You have to trick or convince your mind that you want it. Write a goal down. Next, write down why you want to achieve this goal, what will you gain, how will you feel? A simple goal without a reason, is like going on a trip with nothing in mind, but to simply get to some point to another. Having reasons will make you stay committed.
